pr_title: Implement ephemeral reindex with a persistent task

timeline.message:
Implement ephemeral reindex with a persistent task

This commit implements the non-resilient reindex process by using a the
same persistent task that the resilient reindex process uses. The
difference is that failover is not supported. If a persistent task
detects that it is not the initial assignement, it immediately stops.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe call this resilient like in ReindexTaskParams?
timeline.author: henningandersen

timeline.bodyText: I think that we should ensure that this always runs in all both modes (i.e. the test runs in 3 modes total) to ensure that we cannot break one of the modes in a PR without noticing. This can be done in a follow-up.

timeline.bodyText:
For a non-resilient reindex, I think we could change the failure message in waitForReindexDone further down to signal more precisely that the original coordinator has failed?
I think this is the only real way to get assignment_failed out anyway, since we  now retry indefinitely.

replies.bodyText: I added a new failure message in the case where assignment fails and resilient=false. I left a failure message when resilient=true. I don't think that scenario should happen. But it is nice to have the feedback in case in does happen and we can investigate.

I believe we settled on making this a cluster setting and not a parameter?

I think we should change this to read a system property instead until settled.

replies.bodyText:
I thought I remember that we decided to make it on a per-request basis. Anyway I changed it to a system property for now.
Long term I think a system property == bad since it is node dependent. Sorting seems bad to me since it is super implicit. And cluster setting seems bad to me since there might be valid reasons why you want to faster performance in some circumstances.
